name: Truck Racer
description: Take control of five tons of metal and power, and floor it until you reach the finish line!Drive fully destructible trucks in Championship, Time Attack, Elimination and Quick Race. Get rid of opponents trying to block your way and make a reputation for yourself!
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows® XP updated with the latest Service Pack Processor: Intel® Core 2 Duo or AMD Athlon X2™ 2.8GHz Memory: 2 GB RAM Graphics: NVIDIA® GeForce® 8800 series or ATI™ Radeon™ 4870 DirectX: Version 9.0c Storage: 5 GB available space Additional Notes: Multiplayer modes require an active Internet connection
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows® 7 or 8 updated with the latest Service Pack Processor: Intel® Core i5 2500 or AMD Phenom X4™ 965 Memory: 4 GB RAM Graphics: NVIDIA® GeForce® 560 series or AMD Radeon™ HD 6850 DirectX: Version 9.0c Network: Broadband Internet connection Storage: 5 GB available space Additional Notes: Multiplayer modes require an active Internet connection

reviews.review_text: This MONDAY, MONDAY, MONDAY, throw in some Truck Racer to race TRUCKS or any day really. Get in a Big rig of steel, just like Euro Truck Sim, except now with 100% more racing! Menus are easy to navigate, probably one of the best UI's made in a long time. All the menus are awesome, they flow really easily, not much of a learning curve for people familiar with race games. Best part is I havent noticed that rubber band AI stuff, where one accident spells doom as evry car races past you but no matter how good you do they are always catching up. In fact they crash and all kinds of amusing stuff catching up. The races arent too long, so its easy to play a round then go do something and then pick it up again later. Loads of customization, other trucks, and upgrades keep the game interesting.   Rating: 10/10 Value: $24.99

yep .. i like this game very good .. its got damage physical and mechanical  its got loads of nice feel good racing features and you really feel like theres weight behind them  i like this and i reccomend it too anyone .. great game ..

Nothing inherently wrong with the game. Just an over-all meh experience that is generally too easy. And when you progress to the harder levels of the game, 'hard' = bumper cars. If getting punted all over the race-track by AI-controlled trucks sounds like fun, by all means buy this game. Decent graphics, fair customization and destructible trucks can't make up for the small amount of tracks and locations.   Think of it as an arcade game and get it on sale for 75% off, and you probably won't be too disappointed. But there are better racing games out there.

Nice game. Decent graphics, nice controls, good fun. Don't expect a real sim game. It's an arcade. a good one with it's very own playability. The only problem for me is that the game is very short. it took me less than 10h to complete the single player mode. maybe 20 bucks it's too much for the game... I don't know. But when it's on sale it's a very nice game that I recommend.
What kind of Driving game, doesn't support a wheel? A wannabe driving game. That's what kind. Don't waste your money. Total waste of bit-space. When did steam start selling XBox crap, anyway?

This game plays pretty similar to Flatout. It's called Truck Racer. You race trucks. There's almost nothing to this game besides arrow keys and a boost button. The AI is INSANELY easy, there isn't a single race event I didn't get 1st place in my first time around, usually by 30-60 seconds. You will lap the AI multiple times, but the drifty physics make it still fun to drive around the short tracks. I played through the campaign in 5 hours, although the game had worn off after 2-3.
